intro: Humata dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form humata, is a unique species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinct morphological variation, with two different forms often observed within the same population. The plant typically features elongated leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink in color. Its botanical significance lies in its ability to exhibit dimorphism, which may be influenced by environmental factors. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its adaptive characteristics and ecological role in its native habitat.
